headings: Teacher Education Prof Joins Leadership of State Agency, Nov 25
paragraphs: Our department will prepare you for a rewarding career as an elementary or middle school teacher.
Here, you will gain the real-world knowledge and skills that will allow you to be an effective teacher and make a positive impact on the lives of your future students.
If you are interested in All-Level or Grades 7-12 teacher certification, please check the academic department website for the subject you want to teach.
Refer to theUndergraduate Catalogfor a full list of Minors and their requirements.
This program focuses on assisting paraprofessionals reach their goal of becoming a classroom teacher.
Learn More
Nov 25
May 16
Apr 30

You may remember a particular teacher who made a difference in your life. That is the type of teachers we strive to produce. Your ASU degree is your ticket to join the exciting and dynamic field of professional education, and to teach and shape the young minds who are the future of the world.
Take a look at some other aspects of our department that make ASU an outstanding place to study teacher education.

Get right into the classroom for early field experience as you shadow local teachers and begin teaching short lessons. Then, take advantage of our student-teaching program and our outstanding relationships with school districts in San Angelo and throughout West Texas.

Our Innovative Teaching Center is equipped with the latest in teaching and learning technology, and all our classrooms have the multimedia technology that will prepare you to teach and communicate with your future students.

Join our chapter of the Texas Classroom Teachers Association for networking, community service and social activities. We also have an award-winning chapter of the Kappa Delta Pi international honor society for education.

If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

Reading- Available for the B.I.S. degree by special permission of the department chair of Teacher Education.

“I come from a family of educators, and I enjoy working with small children. I want to teach. I want to help kids.”

Reilly Amsler, Education, Early Childhood - 6 Generalist with ECH-12 Special Ed, Class of 2026

“I want to be able to help special education kids be where I am today and overcome obstacles. I want to help them to be the best that they are capable of. That’s my passion.”

Reilly Amsler, Education, Early Childhood - 6 Generalist with ECH-12 Special Ed, Class of 2026

“I love the campus. Everyone is so nice and friendly, and all the professors are quick to help and care about us as students.”

Reilly Amsler, Education, Early Childhood - 6 Generalist with ECH-12 Special Ed, Class of 2026
